intro: Diapensia himalaica var. acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved diapensia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its densely packed, fleshy leaves that are typically lance-shaped and sharply pointed. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often growing in open meadows or on slopes. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered an important component of alpine ecosystems.
